title: What happened to Jungle-Entrance Covering?
body:
This thread is about a pattern my buddies and me have been encountering more and more frequently over the last 1-2 seasons.
What "covering" means (for those who might not know) is that you buy your starting items as quickly as possible and then rush to your side of the river with the objective of placing a yellow trinket ward at the entrance to your jungle (or mid-river bush) to spot an invading enemy team.
I can remember that when I started playing League in S4, I was always told (and pinged) to "cover" jungle entranecs before going to lane. This is especially important for the mid-/ and botlaner, since this i where most of Lvl1-invades happen.
But now I rarely see this being done by my mid/bot-laners. And sometimes we do get invaded, give up a kill and maybe even another one or two flashes. This is almost always followed by a "gg mid, thx for giving a kill to <<insert enemy midlane champion here>> by the very person who did not help covering the river with a ward.
Agreed, 1 kill might not decide the game, but it gives an early advantage, sets the tone of the game and may even pressure your jungler to start elsewhere, losing time which may have severe effects on lane-pressure.

I am now playing on Gold/Plat-level. Back in S4 when I was playing with mostly Bronze/Silver/Golds this was not the case. In 99% of games people were covering immediately at the start of the game. 
Have players become lazy? or do they not care anymore? Has this LCS-level of earyl game knowledge gotten lost over the years?

replies.body:
you cant buy green wards so other laners are forced to save them for themselves

coupled with any jungler who buys {{item:1409}}  typically clears while they're there anyway making the ward unnecessary to begin with, and thus reserved for objectives like dragon, baron, or for their team mates instead of themselves.

its not that people dont want to, its that they outright cant without pink wards.
Just to avoid a misunderstanding. Im talking ONLY about the very first 90 seconds of the game -> your very first trinked charge.

The CD on Trinket was massively increased with the last change giving charges even to the base trinket. People don't want to use a 120s CD that they will need for covering their lane a few minutes later. Before that, I think it was only 60s.

That being said, they should still cover the entrances, not necessary with a ward, but by being there themselves and being attentive, not idling under their T1.

invades have become rare or even nonexistant without a morgana, thresh, or blitz on the enemy team.

you wont find a random level 2 panth in your jungle with a red buff because tougher mobs early means they're too low to pull it off, it just doesn't need to happen.

when was the last time you were invaded? and what champion was it?

Im not saying its happening every 2nd game, but still as often that I would still be alert about that strategy.
Usually accompanied by one of these fellas in the enemy team: {{champion:53}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:143}}

My personal opinion is that more people are taking breaks between game-loading-start and the minions spawning because of the absurd amount of time it takes to even get into a game. It takes practically the same amount of time to queue up for a game and get it started as it takes to play the damn thing. 

So instead of people taking their break or doing what they need to do _before_ they queue up, they queue up first because they know it's going to take FOREVER and then they go do it while the game is loading.

^This

In many games however the midlaner just stands under turret after buying his/her items (or botlaner/jungler just stand/dance at gromp/krugs).
Regarding your first point, I can see this being the case. Though one would assume that network performance is increaing over the years. :> My perception is also that NCS has indeed increased the time required to get into a game, opposed to blindpick/old teambuilder.
They are really better off just standing there to gain vision of the area until they spot the enemy, or until it is time for them to go to lane.

I would argue that if you just stand in the bush by the river, you are unable to timely escape an invading 4/5 man group with a Blitzcrank/Thresh/Braum on their side. If they spot you it becomes a 50/50 gamble if their skillshots hit you.
A simple yellow trinked ward placed early gives you leeway to stand further back or just go and stand under your tower as well as giving you insight about possible invades.
